page.title: 13THE DANBURY PARKS
page.content: The National Trust owns both Danbury and Lingwood Commons,and also the Lakes.A rather large camp was confirmed on the East side of Danbury Common.Danbury and Lingwood Common and the High Common are the remnants of a forest that covered the Ridge in the Saxon times.Danbury Common used to be an army camp during the French Revolution.Danbury's landscape is composed of shades of many hues.To be found here are the lakes.There is one lake the size of a pond, one that is very big and one that is interesting.In the summer the rhodedendrons bloom,in autumn the different fruits tumble down from the trees,in the winter the lakes and parks freeze and the countryside looks like a crystal forest and when spring comes the leafy shoots burst out starting summer when the cycle begins.
